File path: examples/pytorch/vrgcn/train_cv.py

Docstring empty.

Imports: argparse, dgl, dgl.data.RedditDataset, dgl.function, dgl.nn.pytorch, numpy, time, torch, torch.nn, torch.nn.functional, torch.optim, torch.utils.data.DataLoader, tqdm

Classes: NeighborSampler (samples neighbor subgraphs for mini-batch), SAGE (GraphSAGE model for node embeddings, training and inference utilities), SAGEConvWithCV (GraphSAGE convolution with CV? maybe cross-validation? but just a conv layer with parameter init, forward, reset).

Standalone functions: compute_acc (simple helper compute accuracy), evaluate (unused), init_history (unused), load_subtensor (unused), run (unused), update_history (unknown).

Thus the file likely implements training pipeline for GraphSAGE on Reddit dataset using DGL, with neighbor sampling for mini-batch training, includes functions for accuracy, evaluation, history tracking, etc. However many functions are unused.

Business intent: Provide example of training GraphSAGE with cross-validation? maybe VRGCN stands for Variational Relational Graph Convolutional Network? But the file is train_cv (maybe cross-validation). So business intent: Demonstrate training of GraphSAGE model on large graph dataset (Reddit) using DGL, with neighbor sampling for efficient mini-batch, compute accuracy, evaluate, track training history.

Keywords: graph neural network, GraphSAGE, neighbor sampling, mini-batch training, DGL, PyTorch, Reddit dataset, node classification, accuracy, training loop, cross-validation.
